Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ocellatin-F1 (Fallaxin, XXA; natural AMPs; UCLL1c; frog, amphibians, animals; Derivatives: FA12)
Sequence Information.Source: west Indian mountain chick frog,Leptodactylus fallax. Asia

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against A. actinomycetemcomitans (MIC 24.84 uM), E.coli (MIC 397.45 uM), Stafilococcus.aureus (MIC 109.91 uM), and C. lusitaniae (MIC 50.25 uM) (GusmÃ£o KAG et al., 2017).SAR: N- or C-terminal truncation caused a loss of antimicrobial activity (>100 uM), indicating the requirement of the entire sequence for toxicity. SAR study using ala-scanning of 65 analogs was conducted and FA12 was found to be best candidate ( Protein Sci. 2007 Sep;16(9):1969-76).Structure: Structures were determined by NMR in DPC or SDS (Gomes et al., 2018).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.  Also view related structures via the PDB links. Updated Jan2009; 3/2018; 7/2021.
Literature Information.Author: Rollins-Smith LA, King JD, Nielsen PF, Sonnevend A, Conlon JM.2005
Literature Information.Title: An antimicrobial peptide from the skin secretions of the mountain chicken frog Leptodactylus fallax (Anura:Leptodactylidae).
